pageTitle: Twin Galaxies And DK Forum Top 20 Donkey Kong World Record Scores | Donkey Blog: News, Theory, and Meditations From The World of Competitive Donkey Kong
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {67493=In 1983, I and many others witnessed my friend Henri Lony reaching level 22 with 3 lives left. I do not remember his score but it was over a million. (In my memory he reached level 23 but everybody says that is impossible so it must have been level 22) This happened in Tilburg, Netherlands(gameroom: 26). In my oppinion he still holds the World record. He never played the game again because of disappointment of this death level., 148674=IMPORTANT: In March 2014, Twin Galaxies—which disappeared for several months after the Kong Off 3 in November 2013—re-emerged with a new owner, Jace Hall. The organization has been in the midst of a long restructuring period and has just recently (January 2015) finally begun accepting score submissions again. Bear with them! Please see this post for background., 150478=Neither Steve Wiebe nor Billy Mitchell hold the Donkey Kong world record anymore, though both are still highly revered. Wiebe remains active and a serious force to be reckoned with, particularly in live events like the recent Kong Offs. While he has not had the time or inclination to pursue the world record since 2010, most of today's top players agree that Wiebe has the potential to reclaim it. Mitchell, on the other hand, is no longer competing., 148766=This leaderboard was last maintained on June 25th, 2015., 134270=A note on world records: The Donkey Kong world record as it is known and recognized by Twin Galaxies, Guinness, other score-trackers, the media, the general public, and purists/traditionalists can only be set on an original 1981 arcade machine. Hence, Robbie Lakeman is the reigning world champion, even though Dean Saglio's MAME Arcade Machine Emulator score is higher than Lakeman's arcade score., 94162=I have a quick question i have a 60 in 1 arcade machine it has a small computer chip that runs 60 games would this be consider a MAME style of play even though it has a the classic arcade conrtols and body style? thnx also ive been playing since march 7th 2013 and my best score is 214,600 on lvl 7 is that good, 149909=In 2010, the world record was taken by Dr. Hank Chien, a plastic surgeon from New York City. textBeforeTable: 3rd Through 20th 10/4/2013 Dean Saglio 1,206,800 MAME Emulator World Record* 6/25/2015 Robbie Lakeman 1,158,400 Arcade Machine World Record* IMPORTANT: In March 2014, Twin Galaxies—which disappeared for several months after the Kong Off 3 in November 2013—re-emerged with a new owner, Jace Hall. The organization has been in the midst of a long restructuring period and has just recently (January 2015) finally begun accepting score submissions again. Bear with them! Please see this post for background. This leaderboard was last maintained on June 25th, 2015. This list is only the top 20 out of hundreds of players ranked on the Donkey Kong Forum High Score List. Click to see the whole list, if you would like to submit a score, or to join us in one of our regular online tournaments. The "Billy vs. Steve" era is now history. The movie brought hundreds of new competitors to the game from all over the world (even Eminem!). Brilliant, talented "next generation" players like Chien, Ross Benziger, Vincent Lemay, Robbie Lakeman, Jeff Willms, and
textAfterTable: A note on world records: The Donkey Kong world record as it is known and recognized by Twin Galaxies, Guinness, other score-trackers, the media, the general public, and purists/traditionalists can only be set on an original 1981 arcade machine. Hence, Robbie Lakeman is the reigning world champion, even though Dean Saglio's MAME Arcade Machine Emulator score is higher than Lakeman's arcade score. Some maintain an alternate view that since the game is emulated 100% accurately on MAME, the record should be whatever the highest score is, irrespective of platform. This view would see Saglio as the champ, with Lakeman in 2nd. Without delving into the particulars of the debate, let it be sufficient to note that there are strong cases for both positions. For neutrality's sake, the two records are treated here as parallel entities, or perhaps a split title, with neither being ranked as "1st" or "2nd", and the rankings from there on starting at 3rd place. This solution honors the traditional perception of the world record being necessarily tied to the original arcade hardware (and Lakeman's publicly-recognized status as the Donkey Kong champion), while also respecting the fact that Saglio has technically achieved the highest score.
